sentence: stocks higher Wednesday, with shares of tech stocks in the S&P 500 adding 2.9% in value while the Philadelphia Semiconductor index was posting a 1.5% gain this afternoon.

(+) Aspen Technology ( AZPN ) was hanging onto a 7% advance on Wednesday after Canaccord Genuity raised its investment rating for the asset optimization software company to buy from hold, saying the stock has "a more reasonable" valuation after losing about a third of its value since September.
Canaccord maintained its price target of $100.
(+) Salesforce ( CRM ) shares climbed over 8% on Wednesday after the customer relationship management software firm reported better-than-expected Q3 financial results.

Excluding one-time items, Salesforce earned $0.61 per share during the three months ended Oct. 31, up from a $0.42 per share adjusted profit during the same quarter last year and beating the Capital IQ consensus by $0.11 per share.
Revenue grew 26% year over year to $3.39 billion, also inching past the $3.37 billion analyst mean.

(+) KeyW Holding ( KEYW ) rose nearly 7% on Wednesday, staying near its session high after the security software firm late Tuesday said it received $35 million in new awards and additional work to existing contracts for delivery over the next 12 months to unnamed classified customers.
One contract has the potential to expand by an additional $15 million, KeyW said, adding it will also develop advanced sensor payloads under the contract orders.
(+) Red Hat ( RHT ) was narrowly higher this afternoon after it late Tuesday said it acquired NooBaa, an early-stage company developing data-storage software for hybrid and multicloud environments.
Financial details of the transaction were not disclosed.
Red Hat said the deal adding NooBaa's data management technology will augment its existing portfolio of hybrid cloud offerings.
